title: Ticket #575: gt2 gahp memory leak at BNL
description: Xin Zhao reports that gahp_server processes on their submit nodes are growing to over 1GB in memory usage. There's no reason for a gahp_server to use this much memory, so this is pretty clearly a memory leak.
remarks:
2009-Jun-17 14:35:30 by jfrey:
Email from Xin Zhao:

Also we observe that the memory usage of gahp server increases gradually as time goes by. Today the gahp server for BNL gridgk04 grew to 1.5G, I killed it and the new restarted gahp process uses < 50MB memory. There are still some other gahp servers that have been running for a while and are consuming a good amount of memory. For example process 2585 on gridui07 is using 1G memory now, it serves a Tier3 site that normally runs <5 jobs.

2009-Jul-01 15:23:41 by jfrey:
Extensive valgrinding of the gahp_server has revealed a leak in gsi each time an incoming connection is authenticated. We've opened a bugzilla ticket with Globus: http://bugzilla.globus.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=6787

2009-Jul-01 15:24:38 by jfrey:
We have found and fixed a couple minor memory leaks due to using an old version of the Globus gass server library.

2009-Jul-30 18:57:52 by jfrey:
Joe Bester has provided a patch for the memory leak. A quick test with valgrind shows the leak is gone. I've provided a binary to Xin Zhao to try on BNL's machines.

2009-Jul-30 18:58:30 by jfrey:
The patched gahp_server is here: ftp://ftp.cs.wisc.edu/condor/temporary/forbnl/2009-07-30/gahp_server

2009-Aug-03 10:32:11 by jfrey:
The BNL submit machines have been using the new gahp_server binary since July 30. So far, the memory leak appears to be gone. The patch is committed to the master branch for the next 7.3 release.
